cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 140 mi (225 km) SE of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest toward the middle/upper Texas coast, then slowing, turning north and northeast while skirting the coast and moving inland across southeast Texas toward Louisiana
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast near Matagorda Bay – roughly between Port O’Connor and Freeport, TX

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning (also under Storm Surge Warning)
weather_observation.watch_coast: Baffin Bay to Port Aransas, TX (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Aransas, TX to Morgan City, LA (Tropical Storm Warning); Port Aransas, TX to Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge, LA (Storm Surge Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Middle and upper Texas coast and southwestern Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Sustained tropical-storm-force winds (40–50 mph) likely, with gusts higher as the center nears; peak 50-kt (58-mph) probability 6% in the 24–36 h window.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 3–5 ft above ground possible for San Luis Pass to Sabine Pass, including Galveston Bay; Port Freeport lies within this corridor.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 inches of rain with isolated totals up to 20 inches possible; flash and urban flooding likely around the port complex.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes Monday; hazardous surf and rip currents already occurring.
